result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Iroquois E J Regazzi

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re:  withdrawal of current counsel.  9Iroquois E. J. Regazzi - #588368, Green Bay Correctional Institution, PO Box 19033, Green Bay WI 54307-9033).

Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley appeared by video for Iroquois E J Regazzi.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State. Defense requested an adjournment to allow time to review Discovery. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi in court with attorney Christopher Hartley.  Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi in custody in Green Bay Correctional.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Iroquois E J Regazzi appeared by video means with Attorney.
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of Brown County case #20CF155. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Krohn. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Dodge Correctional fail to produce defendant for court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant was moved from Brown County to Dodge. Dodge doesn't have video available for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court, appear by video. Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Brown County Jail fail to produce defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi in court, in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christopher Hartley appears in person.
**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**

Case calendared for an Order to Show Cause hearing. The State Public Defender's Office has not yet made an appointment. For reasons stated on the record the Court appoints Attorney Christopher Hartley at County expense. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense
Proposed Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi not in court, defendant in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with JDL, AC, ERM, SWA, Officer Gutierrez, Econo Lodge Hotel.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

ADDRESS INFO for Iroquois E J Regazzi
Current: 6320 River Parkway, Wauwatosa, WI 53213 United States  (Effective: 03-26-2022)
Prior: 2833 Riverside Drive, Green Bay, WI 54301

Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Iroquois E J Regazzi in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
